item.title: Introduction to scPred
item.description: Summary scPred is a general method to predict cell types based on variance structure decomposition. It selects the most cell type-informative principal components from a dataset and trains a prediction model for each cell type. The principal training axes are projected onto the test dataset to obtain the PCs scores for the test dataset and the trained model(s) is/are used to classify single cells. For more details see our pre-print on bioRxiv:

item.title: My first post
item.description: I will periodically post articles related to genomics, computational biology, statistics and R. I hope you have fun!
